definition: but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though

sentences.english: The events of the past who mentioned, once again, to forget you.
sentences.chinese: 这往事谁又曾提起，再一次，忘却你。

sentences.english: It is Love to the degree of forgetting oneself in Total Bliss.
sentences.chinese: 它是爱的纯然的喜悦，使自我忘却在其中。

sentences.english: My holidays plan arrive village life, that will let me forget many annoyance.
sentences.chinese: 我假期策动到屯子生活，那会让我忘却许多郁闷。

sentences.english: It took him a long time to unlearn what he learned in his childhood.
sentences.chinese: 经过很长时间他才忘却了儿童时代所学到的知识。

sentences.english: I know you've got a hot date tomorrow night.
sentences.chinese: 我保证在明晚你会拥有一个难以忘却的约会。

sentences.english: She watches intently from her keyhole behind the door of the forgotten room.
sentences.chinese: 她在忘却之室，从门的锁孔密切地注视。

sentences.english: Because of this, unlearning skills doesn't cause an imbalance.
sentences.chinese: 所以忘却交易技能不会引起不平衡。

sentences.english: I know you've got a hot date tomorrow night. Do you have a pre-exisiting personal relationship?
sentences.chinese: 我保证在明晚你会拥有一个难以忘却的约会。

sentences.english: Let's wipe the slate clean and forget our past quarrels.
sentences.chinese: 让我们捐弃前嫌，忘却过去的争吵吧。

sentences.english: To forget how to dig the earth and tend the soil is to forget ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 忘却如何翻耕和照料土地等于忘了我们自己。

sentences.english: "Forget what?" inquired the little prince, who already was sorry for him.
sentences.chinese: “忘却什么呢？”小王子动了恻隐之心。

sentences.english: Forget all the past smoke, heart selfless heaven and earth wide.
sentences.chinese: 如烟往事俱忘却，心底无私天地宽。

sentences.english: The joy of becoming a mother wiped from Lin Yueh-hui's memory all the torments of the medical process.
sentences.chinese: 为人母的喜悦，已使林月惠忘却求医过程所受的折磨。

sentences.english: Yes, I can have a break from all this tired work in the office.
sentences.chinese: 好哇，这样我就可以暂时忘却累人的工作了。

sentences.english: Most Ken forget the ancients poem. The disdain is missing.
sentences.chinese: 最肯忘却古人诗，最不屑一顾是相思。

sentences.english: Concentration on this life can at least temporally make me forget about death.
sentences.chinese: 用，全神贯注于这一生至少使我暂时忘却了死亡。

definition: to be forgotten/to fade from memory
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
deeply immersed/fig. wallowing in/deeply engrossed in
to indulge in/to wallow/absorbed in/deeply engrossed/addicted
